result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Max Jacob Erdmann

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Max Jacob Erdmann in court.  Attorney Matthew Adrian Lamke in court for Max Jacob Erdmann.  Attorney Patrick O'Keefe in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for plea hearing.  Defense requests an adjourned plea/sentencing date.  Court set date as requested.  Case adjourned to Branch 40.  This matter will be held in person in Room 634 of the Courthouse.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for January 11, 2023 at 03:00 pm.
Received and Filed: Pretrial Services 10-10-2022 Supervision Report

Defendant Max Jacob Erdmann in court with attorney Matthew Adrian Lamke. Grace Gall appeared on behalf of Patrick O'Keefe for the State of Wisconsin.

CASE HELD OFF THE RECORD PER JUDGE. Case in Court for Scheduling Conference. Defense requested Plea hearing date. Parties selected date. Case remains calendared in Branch 40. Plea hearing scheduled for October 12, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Received and Filed. Pretrial Services Supervision Report 8-18-2022

Defendant Max Jacob Erdmann in court with attorney Matthew Adrian Lamke.  Patrick O'Keefe appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
CASE HELD OFF THE RECORD PER JUDGE.  Case in court for a scheduling conference.  Defense has not received an offer from the State and requests another scheduling conference.  Court rescheduled the matter as requested.  Case adjourned to Branch 40.  Scheduling conference scheduled for August 19, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Max Jacob Erdmann in court with Attorney Matthew Adrian Lamke; both appear by video.  Erika Strebel appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a Preliminary Hearing. Parties are advised that this case is assigned to Branch 40, Judge Shelton. Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing. Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court held colloquy with defendant. Probable cause has been found and the defendant is bound over for trial. Original Information e-filed, copy given to defense counsel who waived reading. Defense enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of the defendant. Case is adjourned to Br. 40.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 22, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Received and Filed: Pretrial Services Supervision Report 04-26-2022

Defendant Max Jacob Erdmann not in court.  Abby Rockendorf appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is present. Mr Erdmann was present by zoom prior to the case being called. Attorney Lamke does not appear. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 26, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Received and Filed: Pretrial Services Supervision Report- 03-30-2022

Defendant Max Jacob Erdmann in court in person.  Matthew Zisi appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness was present. SPD has not appointed counsel. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 30, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Received and Filed. Pretrial Services Supervision Report - 03-02-2022

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 3.  
No driving without a valid license.

Defendant Max Jacob Erdmann in court with attorney Melissa Jane Fitzsimmons.  Defendant Max Jacob Erdmann in custody.  Ian F Vance-Curzan appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Max Jacob Erdmann appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Shelton, Branch 40. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  
This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 3, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
